cells.data:
Eric-recommended book on Objective-C:
http://www.amazon.co.uk/Learning-Objective-C-2-0-Hands--Developers/dp/0321832086/ref=la_B003OC3IMI_1_2?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1397739370&sr=1-2 (also in the iBooks store, a bit cheaper)

Blog post about Reactive Cocoa:
http://blog.maybeapps.com/post/42894317939/input-and-output

Eric also presented some slides to support, I'm not sure how useful the slides are standalone, but they are below if you want to review:
https://drive.google.com/a/brightcove.com/file/d/0B0qBcMFWthyfbzF6c0hWU2pJQmNGNHBScU5NaG1hUDVOMTFn/edit?usp=sharing

Recently on RayWenderlick.com (a great site for all things iOS/MAC dev, btw), there was a two-part series on Reactive Cocoa:
http://www.raywenderlich.com/62699/reactivecocoa-tutorial-pt1
http://www.raywenderlich.com/62796/reactivecocoa-tutorial-pt2
as well as associated Tech Talk on the subject:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fWV7xyN5CR8
However, if you are not familiar ObjectiveC, you will get horribly lost past 10mins. 

At a prior company, they would give this book to any Engs not familiar with ObjC:
http://www.amazon.com/iOS-Programming-Ranch-Edition-Guides/dp/0321942051

Lastly, Stanford published the entire set of video lectures from their iOS Dev class on iTunes University:
https://itunes.apple.com/us/course/developing-ios-7-apps-for/id733644550
